snippet: Accountable care organizations, a new kind of health care practice, are gaining momentum in part because of the Affordable Care Act signed into law two years ago.
abstract: Accountable care organizations, collections of medical providers who band together under one business umbrella and are paid to care for a group of patients rather than being reimbursed for specific medical services, are gaining momentum in part because of the Affordable Care Act; ACOs have a powerful incentive to provide forward-looking and high-quality care, because they are allowed to keep and divide savings when patients remain healthy.
lead_paragraph: Accountable care organizations, a new kind of health care practice, are gaining momentum in part because of the Affordable Care Act signed into law two years ago.

headline.seo: With Small-Picture Approach, A.C.O.’s Gain in Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
